result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander J. Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case Nos. 13CF80, 13CF74, 13CF60 & 13CF63

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing held on October 31, 2014 - Mary B. Burzynski, RPR
Letter from SPD's Office
All exhibits from sentencing hearing are filed in Case No. 13CF60.
of N.D.R.

Defendant Alexander J. Schneider in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Alexander J. Schneider in custody.  Kristi Sue Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency hearing.  The doctor found Mr.  Schneider to be competent. Exhibit #4 - doctor's report received by the court.   Court finds Mr. Schneider competent.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court receives  Exhibits #2 and 3.  Attorney Voorhees and Attorney Tlusty stated factual changes to the PSI.  Special agent David Forsythe gave statement to the court.  Audio Recording played to the court marked as Exhibit #1.  Statement by victim.  Argument by counsel.  Short recess at 10:51 a.m.   Reconvene at 11:05 a.m.  Statement by Alexander J. Schneider.  Court orders in Case No. 13CF80 - Count 1 - 40 years initial confinement and 20 years extended supervision; count 3 - 2 years initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision; count 4 - 2 years initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision.  Case No. 13CF764 - count 3 - 2 years initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision; count 4 - years initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision; count 5 - 9 months county jail.  Case No. 13CF60 - Count 1 - 9 months county jail.  Case No. 13CF63 - Count 1 - 9 months county jail.  Case No. 14CF16 - Count 1 - 9 months county jail.  The jail sentences are concurrent to each other.  Defendant is to provide letters of apology to the victims as part of his sentence.  Conditions of extended supervision are no contact with the victims in this case; find employment or maintain employment if that is applicable and at agent's discretion; maintain absolute sobriety; AODA and follow through with any recommendations; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; attend any other counseling as recommended by his agent; restitution; no possession of any weapons.  Sentence credit of 418 days on each case.  Court vacates the forfeiture of the cash bonds and orders that the clerk apply those first to restitution and then court costs.  Appeal rights and notice of voter ineligibility given to defendant's attorney.  - rt
Alternative PSI report by Jennifer Hasse-Rau M.S.

Original PSI document filed in case No. 13CF63 and 13CF60
Original Alternative PSI report is in Case 13CF60
Original Competency Report is filed in Case No. 13CF74.
Letter from Attorney Voorhees
Letter from Attorney Voorhees
Sentencing hearing on October 31, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Attorney Tlusty
Sentencing hearing on September 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Alexander J. Schneider in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Stipulation and order signed by court withdrawing Attorney Gardner.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty; response by Mr. Voorhees.  State moved to amend Ct. 1 to misdemeanor battery under 940.19(1).  So ordered.  Parties agree to proceed without a formal amended information/complaint.  DE entered a plea of no contest to amended charge.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement the remaining charge is dismissed and read-in.  PSI requested and ordered on all files.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Cover Letter to Sheriff's Dept with Bond

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  No contact with N.D.R. dob: 12-25-1975.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Alexander J. Schneider in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Alexander J. Schneider in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 10:21 am - case called and ADR started.  Further reading of complaint waived; preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived.  PTC set.  State requested a $5,000 cash bond with booking and no contact with N.D.R. dob: 12-25-1975.  Brief response by Mr. Voorhes.  Court set bond at $5000 cash with conditions as requested.  Case adjourned at 10:28:00 am.
Served to Alexander J. Schneider February 12, 2014 at 8:48 a.m.
